name: Comfort Inn Trolley Square

reviews.text: We were sent to Comfort Inn in late July for an unplanned business meeting. We were happy that they had some small conference rooms available on short notice. We were treated respectfully by the hotel staff which we appreciated.
reviews.title: An odd place for a hotel

reviews.text: On the negative side, the sleeping room had some sort of odor, maybe old cigarette smoke, but we werent sure. We asked for another room and that room also an odor to it. the 3rd room we tried was fresh and clean so we ended up happy.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: Also, the location of this hotel is really odd. While the sign is on the main road (Route7), the hotel sits in back of other businesses. We drove past 3 times until we were able to figure out where the hotel was. We used the entrance on Allen Street which was plainly obvious. Trying to find the hotel from Route 7 is impossible and difficult with all the traffic flowing by.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is one of the nicest chain hotels I have stayed at. The Service was excellent. The self service breakfast had plenty food to pick from and the lady who worked there has very helpful and gracious. The price was most responsible. This place very centrally located to restauants, shopping and the Rutland CC is only a couple miles away. I would stay the again in a heart beat.
reviews.title: 4th of July

reviews.text: I got there around 1am and was treated nicely and got a great room. The room was clean and had all the amenities. I didn't use the pool, but I did see it and it looked very nice. The free breakfast was simple (bagels and coffee). I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in the area.
reviews.title: Comfort inn is quirky

reviews.text: I don't know if Choice Hotels has been making an effort to improve customer service at their facilties, but if so, it has made a difference at this hotel in Rutland. We stayed overnight and found the service very friendly and helpful, indeed-- sincerely so. The room was clean and attractive, with all amenities in good working order. The continental breakfast was served in a comfortable space on the third floor-- unremarkable, with all the usual morning suspects (including the now ubiquitous waffle maker)-- but it was fine and tided us over well until later in the day. The location is convenient, right off route 4. We were pleased with our stay, which exceeded what we were expecting.
reviews.title: Happily Surprised by the Frieldy Customer Service

reviews.text: I stayed for 1 night recently and found the room to be clean and quiet. The layout was odd, in that the 2 armchairs faced the bed instead of the flat screen TV. The bathroom was large and appeared to have been built for handicap access, as the tub had railings and a hand held shower set up.
reviews.title: Service fabulous by day and poor at night

reviews.text: The service I received upon 9:30pm check in was indifferent at best. As such, I was really shocked at the great service I received from the front desk the next morning. That lady could not have been more friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: angry

reviews.text: I can't speak to the food quality, as I had breakfast at the McDonald's across the street (hotel breakfast ends at 9:30am). There is also a Dunkin Donuts a couple of blocks away and a full service restaurant in the same strip mall area.
reviews.title: Nice enough place off the beaten path

reviews.text: The place is about a mile from downtown Rutland, so it's walking distance if you want to have a nice stroll through the (very pleasant) town and have a nice lunch. Supposedly there is a bus for 50 cents that stops near the Dunkin Donuts, but it's faster to just walk downtown from the hotel. Killington is about a $30 cab ride away.
reviews.title: Great price, far from the action though

reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights over New Year's, skiing in the area (very convenient for Pico and Killington, about 30 minutes from Okemo, a bit of a trek to Bromley). Nothing fancy, but a step up from the Red Roof Inn, and a few minutes closer to downtown (which was near enough to walk to restaurants). Typical chaos at breakfast as 50 people tried to use two waffle makers, but you should know what to expect when you're staying in this type of hotel. Pool was OK, though the staff were rather slow with keeping up with the towel requirements. Only 50 yards from MacDonald's, which is a blessing with kids. Rooms on 3 floors, so could get a bit noisy from above as well as the sides. Free Internet worked pretty well. We found that the best room-rate was by phoning directly for reservation and using AAA.
reviews.title: About right for a family ski trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend $110.00 plus tax for an average room. The room was excessively hot and attempts to turn down the heat was useless. Ended up turning the entire unit off. At least we were able to open the window for the night. The television was old and the picture had a severe red tint to it. Although clean the room was average and I don't believe worth the price. In the morning when I complained about the heat, the desk clerk said "oh everyone has been complaining about that".
reviews.title: No value here

reviews.text: What a nasty place to stay! If I hadn't been exhausted from flying all the way across the country I wouldn't have stayed. The carpet was so awful I left socks on until I went to bed. The AC/heat unit was so filthy I wouldn't even touch it to change the temp. Bedspread had large stain, bathroom narrow, fan continually ran when light turned on, counters and tile dirty. Parking had very minimal lighting - not good for women traveling along. Overall wouldn't put my dog in there!
reviews.title: Wouldn't put my dog in there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked this hotel due to ratings we have seen on goolge maps - not on tripadvisor. Google showed greater results than those here. The second reason was because we made great experiences with choice hotels in the last nights (Burlington). This time it was even better. The rooms are very quite, clean and the staff was very welcoming. Thank you Rick!
reviews.title: Great value - even greater staff

reviews.text: The Vermont Fair is running for 10 days and every hotel in town is booked. We stayed at Comfort Inn for the first night and another the second night.
reviews.title: Mysterious Odor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I bought through Priceline and of course getting a good price always influences one's opinions of a place. That said, I found the hotel very pleasant, sort of oddly located off the main highway, and the staff at the desk very helpful with directions to the restaurant I wanted to go to, and with a museum we planned to visit. It has what appeared to be a very nice pool and hot tub, but I was too tired to take advantage of it. No problems at all with this place.
reviews.title: Clean attractive convenient friendly Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at hotel over president's day weekend for skiing at Killington/Pico Mountain. 10 minute drive to the mountains. Rooms were basic but clean. Pool and hot tub were great and a big plus after an entire day of skiing. Continental breakfast included that was good as well. Would definitely stay here again if skiing in the area.
reviews.title: Very good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent one night at the Comfort Inn Trolley Square with my wife. Our
reviews.title: Nice basic clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: original plan was to spend two nights at the Hampton Inn in Rutland, but
reviews.title: Good Value Accomodation

reviews.text: due to an upcoming snowstorm that was suppose to hit home, we decided to
reviews.title: NICE HOTEL FOR THE MONEY

aka: Comfort Inn Trolley Square Hotel Rutland
